Just curious, but has she had her hormones/testosterone checked?  I was diagnosed with Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome, which is caused by an insulin resistant hormone.  This can cause the weight problems.  It is my understanding that unless the hormone is stabilized, diet and exercise wont do hardly anything.  I now have to take Metformin (just started taking it) to get mine under control.  Once this kicks in, with diet and exercise I should start seeing results.  I also had 2 abdominal surgeries and my problems from this syndrome kicked in afterward.  Probably unrelated to the surgeries, unless there's some weird hormonal imbalance that can occur after a surgery...;) (OK, you know I'm kidding) Oh, I tested normal on all of the same tests she took too.  It wasnt until a DR finally tested my testosterone level and it was elevated.  Unexplained weight gain and not being able to lose it despite true efforts is a sign of this that many people with this syndrome complain about.  BUT, unexplained weight gain can be a variety of problems, but look into all angles.  Good luck!
